questions.text: A 54-year-old woman undergoes a colonoscopy to screen for colon cancer. Biopsy of a polyp removed during the procedure reveals epithelial cell metaplasia, with some cells progressing toward malignant transformation. A high-fiber diet is prescribed to generate more short-chain fatty acids. The figure below illustrates the concentration of protonated short-chain fatty acids on either side of a colonic epithelial cell membrane. If the concentration of fatty acids on the outside surface of the cell doubles, the rate of diffusion of the short-term fatty acids will change from 10 mg/h to which of the following rates?

5-day-old infant starts having brief tonic–clonic seizures throughout the day. His neurological function in between seizures is normal, and he has no other medical or neurological problems. The history reveals no readily apparent causes for the seizures, though the mother recalled that her first baby also developed seizures shortly after birth that only lasted for 2 weeks, with no subsequent episodes or developmental problems. Genetic analysis revealed a mutation of voltage-gated K+ channels consistent with a diagnosis of benign familial neonatal seizures. Which of the following would cause an immediate reduction in the amount of potassium leaking out of a cell?

options.label: D
options.text: Increasing the permeability of the membrane to potassium

questions.text: 1- year-old male is found to have high blood pressure, normal genitalia on physical examination, low serum aldosterone and high serum testosterone. Which of the following is most likely to be elevated in this patient?
Which of the following is a correct description of connections involving cerebellar neurons?

options.label: A
options.text: Basket cells release glutamate to activate Purkinje cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Climbing fiber inputs exert a strong excitatory effect on Purkinje cells, and mossy fiber inputs exert a weak excitatory effect on Purkinje cells.

options.label: C
options.text: Granule cells release glutamate to inhibit basket cells and stellate cells.

options.label: D
options.text: The axons of Purkinje cells are the sole output of the cerebellar cortex, and they release glutamate to excite the deep cerebellar nuclei.

questions.correct_answer: B. Climbing fiber inputs exert a strong excitatory effect on Purkinje cells, and mossy fiber inputs exert a weak excitatory effect on Purkinje cells.

A 28 year old Man presented to General Practitioner with Facial-Sparing Maculopapular Rash with Involvement of Palms & Soles. He also complains of a Painless, Solitary Ulcer on his penis. What is the Diagnosis?
A 9 year old girl is brought with complaints of itchy lesions on his face for 7 days. On examination, multiple ruptured blisters with Honey-colored crusting are seen. What is the Diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • -Non-Bullous Impetigo/Impetigo Contagiosa:
  • • Etiology: Streptocooci and Staphylococci
  • • Age Group: Children
  • • Site: Perioral, Perinasal
  • • Lesion: Golden Yellow or Honey Colored Crust
  • • Complication: Post-Streptocoocal Glomerulonephritis due to Hypersensitivity Reaction.
  • • Bullous Impetigo /Pemphigus Neonatorum :
  • • Etiology : Staphylocoocus Aureus
  • • Toxin: Epidermolytic Toxin liberated by Staphlyococcus Aureus
  • • Lesion: Hypopyon Sign (The pus gravitates to the lower half of Bulla).
  • • Crust: Varnish Crust when the lesions resolve
  • • Management: Topical Antibacterials ; 1.Fusidic Acid 2. Mupirocin: Inhibit MRSA, therefore used in nasal carriers.

questions.text: All are the things to be noted in a patient of congenital glaucoma of 1 year old during examination except
What will be the diagnosis of given Acid-Base Disorder? Ph=7.44 HCO3-: 34 Pco2: 40
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Ph=7.44 → Increased ph → Alkalosis
  • • HCo3-=34 → Increased → Primary Metabolic defect
  • • So it is Metabolic Alkalosis.
  • • Compensation for Metabolic Alkalosis : (0.9*Pts HCO) + 16
  • • Expected Increase in PCO2= 47 mm
  • • But Report shows PaCO2 of 40mm – Hence Uncompensated.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about confidence intervals is true?

questions.text: A 34-year-old female patient is posted for laparoscopic cholecystectomy under general anesthesia. The patient has a past medical history of asthma on regular treatment with last exacerbation a month back. Rest all investigations are normal. Standard induction is done with propofol and fentanyl with vecuronium as muscle relaxant and cuffed endotracheal tube is inserted and confirmed in position using a capnography trace on the monitor. Shortly after the commencement of the surgery, the ventilator suddenly start showing alarm of increased peak airway pressures and the capnography waveform changes to image A. the anaesthesiologist immediately identifies the problem and intervenes and after 10 mins the capnograph changes to image B. which of the following is true about the intervention by the anesthesiologist?

options.label: A
options.text: The anesthesiologist immediately changed the endotracheal tube with a larger tube

options.label: B
options.text: The anesthesiologist immediately deepened the plane of anesthesia by a bolus dose of propofol

options.label: C
options.text: The anesthesiologist changed the ventilator settings to higher tidal volume

options.label: D
options.text: The anesthesiologist informed the surgeon to stop the surgery

questions.correct_answer: B. The anesthesiologist immediately deepened the plane of anesthesia by a bolus dose of propofol

questions.text: An 18 year old unmarried female has been brought to a doctor. options.text: Privation of any member or joint

options.label: D
options.text: Inability to follow one’s ordinary pursuits for a period of a week

questions.correct_answer: D. Inability to follow one’s ordinary pursuits for a period of a week

questions.text: Garlic like odor is present in breath and excreta in poisoning by
Pregnant woman undergoes Pulmonary Function testing. There is no respiratory abnormality. Which of the following Parameters would be decreased?

options.label: D

questions.text: Identify the ovarian tumour
Which of the following are features of adenomyosis 1) Globular enlarged uterus 2) Fixed uterus 3) Tender uterus 4) Tender uterosacral nodules Answer as per the key below
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • -Endometrial Tissue is present inside the myometrium.
  • • -Most common symptom is 2º Dysmenorrhea + Menorrhagia.
  • • -On P/V examination: Uterus is Symmetrically enlarged.
  • • -Size: 10-12 weeks pregnant uterus size, Symmetrically enlarged globular Uterus.
  • • Uterus is Tender: Halban Sign.
  • • -Uterus is Mobile.
  • • TVS findings: Heterogenous appearance of myometrium called as Salt Pepper Appearance.
  • • Myometrial Cysts
  • • Sub-endometrial Striations known as Venetian Bind Appearance
  • • MRI: Thickened Junctional zones more than or equal to 12mm.
  • • Gold standard: Histopathological Examination
  • • Mx: TAH+BSO

questions.text: 28 year aged women is a chronic Hypertensive. She visits the clinic for preconception counselling. Which of the following Anti-Hypertensives need to be stopped prior to conception?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • ACE-Inhibitors-----→ Fetal Renal Agenesis-----→ Oligohydramnios---→ Potter`s Syndrome.
  • • ACE-Inhibitors, ARB Blockers, Beta-Blockers, Diuretics are contra-indicated in Pregnancy.

questions.text: A 30year old Primigravida presents with vaginal bleeding at 34weeks. She had a similar episode a few weeks earlier which she ignored. On examination, her HR and BP are normal and FHR is 140 bpm. The uterus is relaxed. What is the next best step in management?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • The next best step would be to confirm the diagnosis by doing Ultrasound.
  • • In Placenta previa <37 weeks, where the maternal and Fetal condition are stable, McaFee Johnson expectant management can be given.

questions.text: Which of the following is not the initial treatment for a woman with pcos and BMI 30 with menstrual irregularity and hirsutism
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • -Weight Reduction , Lifestyle changes are the initial treatment and strating her on OCPs for menstrual irregularity.
  • • -Patients developing insulin resistance can be controlled by metformin.

questions.text: Woman having history of recurrent abortions is now diagnosed with APLA. What will be the treatment?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Aspirin and Heparin is the most effective therapy for Anti-Phospholipid Syndrome.

questions.text: What is the most common cause of Post-menopausal bleeding?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • -HRT is the second most common cause of Post-menopausal bleeding.

questions.text: Which of these clinical conditions does not have XY karyotype
Which of the following is not the support of the uterus?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Ligament Supports of Uterus:
  • • Muscle Support of Uterus:
  • • -Levator Ani Muscle (Most important support-overall)
  • • -Superficial and Deep Transverse Perineal Muscle
  • • -External Anal Sphincter
  • • -External Urethral Sphincter
  • • -Bulbo-spongiosus Muscle

questions.text: Identify the maneuvers as shown in the image?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • It causes flexion of legs against abdomen and Abduction of Hips. Two assistance one on each side are required. There is rotation of pubic symphysis upward and straightening of the lumbo-sacral angle. This increases the antero-posterior diameter of Maternal Pelvis.
  • • -Most common nerve injured during this maneuvers is Lateral Cutaneous Nerve of thigh.

questions.text: In a pregnant women, the inner cell divides on the 7th day. Which of the following is not the complication of this multifetal Pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Cord Entanglement is seen in Monoamniotic twins not in Diamniotic twins.
  • • Other complications in the above option are seen in Monochorionic Diamniotic Twins.

questions.text: Match the following ovarian tumours with the characteristic features Answer using the code below
What is the leopold`s maneuver as shown in the image?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Leopold 1st, 2nd and 3rd are done facing the face of the patient.
  • • Leopold 4th -Done facing the feet of the patient.

questions.text: All coagulation factors increase in Pregnancy except?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • As Pregnancy is a Hypercoagulable state, this is to prepare body to prevent blood loss during labor. Anti-coagulants like Protein-C decreases.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a component of Fetal Biophysical score?

A lady on oral contraceptive pills presented with white discharge per vaginum. It is not associated with itching or foul smell and stains her underwear . Examination of the discharge revealed normal Lactobacilli and acidic pH. What is the diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Criteria for Leucorrhea are:
  • • -Nonirritant and non-Pruritic
  • • -Non-Purulent and non-offensive
  • • -Excess secretion is evident from persistent vulval moistness or staining of the undergarments or need to wear a vulval pad.
  • • The physiologic basis is dependent on the endogenous Estrogen level.

questions.text: Match the columns of antenatal testing with their ideal POG Answer using the code below
You are attending a delivery. A 1200gm, 27 weeks gestation baby is born limp. After doing the routine steps, the baby is gasping. What should be the next step?

options.label: D
options.text: Start PPV with 100% Oxygen with Chest compressions

questions.text: A 5-year-old girl is unresponsive, not breathing, and pulseless. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is being performed. The cardiac monitor reading is shown below. Which of the following interventions should be performed next?

options.label: C
options.text: Establish vascular access and administer epinephrine.

options.label: D
options.text: Establish vascular access and insert an advanced airway.

questions.text: All of the following can be the result of carpal tunnel syndrome except :
